posts.body: Can we implement bumping, so that the threads with the newest replies can get bumped to the top?
Some more details about how they deplatformed 8ch and bitimitigate from (((techcrunch)))

>>25e3ad90-5dc4-4d91-9eec-be00bd51a4bb
>https://twitter.com/infinitechan/status/1158900722425110529

How I would reply:

What you are calling "extremist content" is exactly the type of content that is protected by the 1st amendment.  If it was not extreme, it wouldn't need protection.

Most of the 'extremist content' has long been suspected of being the work of agents of the FBI/CIA/ATF/IRS and other government agencies.  There is even a special term for them "glowniggers".

This theory has been confirmed (see the attached content).  Government agents have been posting to our website and encouraging people to radicalize and commit acts of violence.

I believe that attempts to shut down our website have nothing to do with the 'extremist content' that is created by government agents, but rather with an attempt to shutdown discussion of Jews being overrepresented in the media and questioning the legitimacy of the state of Israel.

China is very aggressive in blocking content it doesn't like.

They're probably studied the protocol/ports that 8chan uses and have put in place a bunch of strategies to block them at the national firewall level.

zeronet is the kind of things that make the Chinese government very uneasy, so I'm sure they have downloaded the source code and studied it line by line to implement a blocking strategy.

>Is the federal government carrying out terrorist attacks on civilians in the U.S. in order to give the appearance that their hands are tied, and that we must usher in gun control?

Of course it's true.  Have you been living under a rock all these years?

posts.subject: Israeli Nuclear Weapons Discussion Thread
posts.body:
Do the Jews in Israhell have nuclear weapons?  Why or why not?

How many weapons do they have? Is it true that they're all aimed at European capitals?  

Did Epstein escape to Israell?

>>79332dda-59b0-489e-86ea-9682c14fec55
HK cannot win a conflict with mainland China because it is tightly integrated with it.

China wouldn't even need troops to crush an uprising in HK. It would only need to turn off the water supply.  Much of the water in HK comes from the mainland.

Now, they may prefer to use troops, however.

The only chance that HK would really have of 'winning' would be to help the revolt spread to the mainland.  But so far the Communist government seems to be capable of preventing that from happening.
